title: Bug 7785 - SaveAs Forgets the file type
description: The SaveAs functionality in the software forgets to include the file type when saving a modified java file. Additionally, the icon for the saved file has changed from the original java file icon to a generic file icon.
OB:
1) Open an existing java file
2) Modify the file (e.g., move an existing class)
3) Click the SaveAs icon, located next to the Save Icon
4) A dialog will appear
5) Browse for a valid container location
6) Type the filename in the text field, but ignore the file extension
7) Click Ok

Observed Behavior: The file is added to the specified location in the Navigator, but no file extension is displayed for the saved file.
EB: The software should include the appropriate file extension when saving a file using the SaveAs feature. Additionally, the icon for the saved file should match the original java file icon.
SR:
1) Open an existing java file
2) Modify the file
3) Click the SaveAs icon
4) Browse for a valid container location
5) Enter the filename without the file extension
6) Click Ok
